boat.full_description:
Tommy Bolton bought Maria in 1961 after she had been lying sunk in a creek at Tollesbury for about six years. In cleaning her out he removed ten gallons of live eels. He rigged her as a schooner and took part in the first OGA East Coast Race, 1963. Visit Colm's photostream on Flickr for photos of the East Coast Race, 2014.

After spending some time in the Netherlands as a live aboard, Maria returned to Essex for a full re-build in 2004. Re-launched in 2007, she won the Classic Boat Restoration of the Year Award in 2008.
boat.name: Maria
boat.short_description: Built as a cutter rigged smack in 1866, Maria was used by the Levett family of Tollesbury for about 80 years.
